page.title: 20Summary of Beaconsfield Life
page.content: Tuesday morning, the market stall holders are setting up their tables for the weekly open-air market. Food and clothes stalls are added and the market grows in size. In the New Town the shop assistants of Waitrose start arriving, people rush through the High Street in their smart clothes hoping not to miss their London-bound trains. 4 o'clock, schoolchildren fill the pavements, the stalls pack up, rush hour traffic starts to clog the streets until Waitrose's lights dim and a shadow covers the High Street. Saturday sees the streets full of teenagers, mothers with children, visitors, tennis players, cricketers. Sunday comes, people going to Church, dinners roasting, early bedtimes. Monday morning, streets jammed with schoolchildren, cars, commuters - another week in Beaconsfield begins.
